meanings.definition: To satisfy a condition or requirement sufficiently.
meanings.sent1: I will satisfice the rules by following them exactly.
meanings.sent2: She always satisfices the criteria for the job.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to satisfice the assignment, but it was too challenging.
meanings.sent4: He managed to satisfice the demands of his boss without much effort.
meanings.sent5: In order to pass the test, you must satisfice all the questions.

meanings.definition: To settle for something that is good enough rather than seeking the best possible option.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes it's better to satisfice than to spend too much time deciding.
meanings.sent2: I will satisfice with this phone even though it's not the latest model.
meanings.sent3: She decided to satisfice with the first dress she tried on.
meanings.sent4: He chose to satisfice with a smaller portion to save money.
meanings.sent5: Don't just satisfice with the first option, explore more choices before deciding.
